intro: Cryptantha flava, commonly known as the yellow globe-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Cryptantha flava is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
